gantrytips.tip: The CSS Style setting allows you to easily change the whole look of your site. The different CSS styles are a selection of preset settings such as background colors and font settings. A little preview thumbnail can be seen in the Overview tab.

The Background Color setting provides the ability to easily change the color used as the background. Colors can be inputted via the Colorchooser popup selector or manually using a hex code in the input field.

The Header Color setting provides the ability to easily change the color used as the background. Colors can be inputted via the Colorchooser popup selector or manually using a hex code in the input field.

The Bottom Color setting provides the ability to easily change the color used as the background. Colors can be inputted via the Colorchooser popup selector or manually using a hex code in the input field.

The Footer Color setting provides the ability to easily change the color used as the background. Colors can be inputted via the Colorchooser popup selector or manually using a hex code in the input field.

The Link Color setting provides the ability to easily change the color used to highlight links. Colors can be inputted via the Colorchooser popup selector or manually using a hex code in the input field.

This setting allows you to use 3rd party WebFonts from providers such as Google. You must first set WebFonts to show and then save your changes, then the available WebFonts will appear in the Font Settings dropdown from where they can be selected.
A selection of fonts to be applied to your site's frontend is available from the Font Settings dropdown. It is also possible to set the Font Size according to your preference.

This is a global setting that loads the comments form in the theme. If you want to use a 3rd party comments system please disable that toggle to keep the WordPress comments enabled, but not loaded in the Gantry based theme.
